page.title: 05BEACHES IN MAWNAN
page.content: There is a wide variety of beaches around Mawnan.{Maenporth}is the biggest it is wide and sandy.It can be dangerous and is patrolled by life savers.There are two Cafes and two Car Parks for 100 cars.The" Ben Asdale"was wrecked on the rocks during a blizzard in 1979 and still lies an eyesore and danger on the rocks.The other beaches are along the{Helford River}they are covered in shingle and have many rock pools.The farthest is{Prisk}which is very rocky and is good for snorkelling {Porthallack}and{Porth Saxon}are small coves.{Grebe}is popular with the locals as it is excellent for swimming.{Durgan}was a small fishing hamlet it now consists mainly of holiday cottages many of which are owned by the National Trust.All of these beaches are full of seashore creatures and aren't polluted.
